item.title: Final Fantasy XIV Patch 7.3 Adds New Dungeons and More in August
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/final-fantasy-xiv-patch-73-august

Square Enix has revealed roughly when you can expect Final Fantasy XIV Patch 7.3 to land, as well as what it'll bring to the long-running MMORPG when it arrives.

Per a new thread on social media platform X, Patch 7.3 will arrive in early August, and it'll continue the story of March's Patch 7.2. As part of that story continuation, you can look forward to a new dungeon by the name of the Meso Terminal, which will serve as a "glittering monument to Alexandria's eternal queen".

The new update will also continue the ongoing Final Fantasy XI-themed 24-person raid, the second part of which will be called "San d'Oria: The Second Walk". Presumably, you'll be exploring the city of the same name from Final Fantasy XI, although given that these raids often take players through some weird and wonderful setpieces, that may not be where you end up.

As well as the new story dungeon, you can also expect a brand new Treasure Dungeon to explore in the form of Vault Oneiron, which promises brand new rewards to collect as well.

The Cosmic Exploration feature, which is open to crafting and gathering professions, will expand in the new update as well, giving you a whole new planet to discover in the form of Phaenna. Who knows what you'll find for your Hand or Land journey there?

A new Deep Dungeon, Pilgrim's Traverse, will also be available, so if you prefer to take on combat-oriented challenges rather than crafting (or if you're planning to do both), you'll probably want to tackle that one as well.

If you play as a Hrothgar or a Viera, you'll be pleased to know there are also new headgear options available for these races, so your fashion options will be expanded when August rolls around.

Final Fantasy XIV Patch 7.3 launches sometime in August. We don't have a more concrete release date for it yet, so stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.4 Release Date Set for July
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/honkai-star-rail-version-34-release-date

Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.4, the latest update for HoYoverse's turn-based gacha RPG, launches early next month, the developer and publisher has announced.

Per a press release, Version 3.4, also known as "For the Sun Is Set to Die", arrives on July 2nd. Following on from May's Version 3.3, the new update will see you stand shoulder-to-shoulder with Phainon "at the crossroads of destiny" in order to "take a decisive step that may ignite the dawn of the Era Nova".

Since this is a Honkai: Star Rail update, you can, of course, also look forward to brand new characters, and this time around, you're getting three, although two of them are guests from another franchise altogether.

The first new character joining the roster in Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.4 is Phainon, who can essentially take over the battlefield when he transforms into his Ultimate form. As you can probably imagine, he's a pretty reliable damage-dealer, so take him if you need some destruction in your lineup.

Your other two characters in this update are both visitors from the Fate/stay night franchise, namely Archer and Saber. Archer will be available for free once the crossover event begins, as will Saber. The latter will be a five-star fighter as well, so she'll be a valuable addition to your team.

This update will also bring reruns for Tribbie, Sunday, and Sparkle, while in the second half, you'll get another chance to add Firefly, Jingliu, and Blade to your team.

You can check out the debut trailer for Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.4 right here. It gives a flavor of what you'll be doing when you begin your adventure next month.

Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.4 lands on July 2nd across all platforms. The game is currently available on PC, PlayStation 5, and mobile devices running both major operating systems.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Palworld Terraria Update Arrives Next Week, New Animated Trailer Released
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/palworld-terraria-update-release-date

Pocketpair has revealed when we can expect the Palworld Terraria crossover to land, and we're just a few days away from the creature-collecting survival game's first ever collaboration.

Per a new trailer, you can expect the appropriately-named "Tides of Terraria" update to arrive on June 25th, and it sounds like you can look forward to a new dungeon to explore, new enemies to fight, and perhaps even some sweet gear to net yourself.

According to Pocketpair, the Terraria bosses Eye of Cthulhu and Moon Lord will both be appearing in the crossover as well, so if you haven't had your fill of fighting those enemies in Terraria, you're in luck.

The Palworld Terraria crossover was first announced all the way back in November, so Pocketpair and Terraria studio Re-Logic have been cooking this one up for quite some time.

It'll serve as Palworld's first crossover, but it likely won't be the game's last; in the Palworld roadmap released in January, Pocketpair teased "game collaborations (including Terraria)", which would indicate that more crossovers are on the way later down the line.

For now, though, you'll have to content yourself with this one, as well as all the other stuff Palworld has going on. Back in March, for instance, Pocketpair released an update for the game that introduced crossplay, allowing you to team up with your friends to take on challenges and raise Pals (or exploit them, if such is your wont).

It's not all fun and games, though. In May, it was revealed that some of Palworld's mechanics have changed because of an ongoing lawsuit brought against the game and its developer by Nintendo. As you've probably guessed, the lawsuit alleges legally spurious similarities between Palworld and the Pokemon franchise.

In any case, the Palworld Terraria collaboration launches on June 26th. You can check the former out right now (albeit in Early Access) on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
